alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 23 at 3:54PM CDT until March 23 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern McIntosh County in southeastern Oklahoma... Central Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Okfuskee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 353 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northwest of Pharoah, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Okemah... Henryetta... Morris... Weleetka... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Hoffman... Clearview... Bald Hill... Okmulgee State Park... Pharoah... Hitchita... Bryant... Eram... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 219 and 243. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail up to golf ball size. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
